description: Borrowed from Yiddish קניידל‎ (kneydl), cognate to German Knödel (“dumpling”). Doublet of quenelle.

nouns.description: knaidel (plural knaidels or knaidlach or knaidloch)

entries.meaning: A type of dumpling made of matzo eaten by Ashkenazi Jews during Passover.
examples: There she tests the offending knaydl. Once again the golf ball scoots around the bowl.
